text: Is it possible to have category pages from a dropdown? Eg if the dropdown in HUBDB has option A, B and C, create pages for A, B and C that only show the items in those categories. Is this possible?

Yes indeed. It can get a bit complicated depending on what you are exactly trying to pull off. But if you want them to be dynamic you will want to turn your dropdown into it’s own hubdb table and use it as a foreign id column instead of the traditional dropdown.

If you are ok rolling pages ABC on your own you can just make them static pages with a module that pulls from that hubdb table and just sort/filter the column value that youre looking for
That seems pretty manual, could we like create a page module with a dropdown for example, then that dropdown on the page would dictate the filter that is used? Is that possible
Appreciate the help btw!

Im not entirely following. by “sort/filter the column value youre looking for” I def meant that you can add whatever fields you need to make it interactive enough for a content editor to change filters etc. But You will have to manually align the dropdown options with the filter options. Sometimes its better to just have it be a text field in case those hubDB column options change.
Is that what youre getting at?
i believe so, so i would create the dropdown manually as the module and then just copy over manually from the filter option in HubSpot?
i think we are on the same page
Yessir — Then obviously you would have to create the logic inside the module to handle all of the filtering etc.
Thanks, i'll be giving that a go tomorrow, can I @ you if I have any further questions?
for sure!
Much appreciated! Have a great day!
I have a HUBDB row with a multi select column "States". Each row is a person that can be tagged with multiple states. How do you filter the table by all rows with that state option value?
Are you trying to let the visitor to the site do this on the frontend? Or on page load via hubl?
page load via hubl
this is what I have so far. It is a directory of salespeople who have different sales territories. So it has name, phone, email, states, and company columns

I think `row.states` is going to return you an array of objects. Try pprinting it to be sure. But I think youre going to need to do one more step. Loop through the `row.states`   array and pull out all of the `name`  values into its own temp array.

then your new do statement could look something like `{% do contacts_us_ar.append(row) if temp_states_array is containing "US-AR" %}`
But that hinges on whether or not im remembering correctly how the mutli-select is returned
I really appreciate your help here BJ and I read your blog posts. They are very helpful. I will give this a try

Appreciate it! You know I get a lot of questions on filtering hubdb stuff like this. Def would be a good topic for a post here in the future. Ill try to whip one up this week. At the very least it will just be a good reference.
I think you should be able to filter for the states at the HubL function level, does that not work for some reason?

<@U6W3H6YN8> I’ve never been able to get the supplied “column_name__contains=<value>” or select_attr to work with multi-select fields. But wouldnt you know it,  I just tried it again and it def works…

Hi Will. This is where I started but I couldn't get it working.   {% set filters = "&States=US-AR" %}
  {% set table_filtered = hubdb_table_rows(module.hubdbtable_field, filters)%} I also tried {% set contacts_us_mi = table|selectattr('states','containing','US-AR') %}
`States__contains=US-AR` Give that a try
Make sure that the column States’ name is actually title case. It defaults to all lower with underscores unless you’ve changed it.
ok I will thanks

I have some logic for each state content group. I was going to try using a macro but how would i use "US-AR" for the logic?
<https://gist.github.com/JacobLett/7371ad1b61be8dfe428caac5f0a12990>
is there some type of way to escape the macro variable to write it in place of a string?
Hm not sure I understand the question, what is the macro being used for exactly? Are you just trying to figure out how to pass a variable into the functions filter?

Yea I was thinking what BJ proposed, like
```hubdb_table_rows(5387687, "States__icontains=US-AL")```
thank you Will I will give that a try
